features: Eco-friendly Material: ECO BOOM wet wipes are crafted from non-woven bamboo viscose fiber, setting them apart from regular wet wipes. This choice of material makes our wipes more environmentally friendly while maintaining a gentle touch on your baby's skin.

Pure and Safe Composition: Our wipes have a simple and safe structure, with water being the primary ingredient to protect delicate skin. We ensure that no toxic or heavy metals are used during production. The ingredients include 100% Bamboo Viscose, Purified Water, Sodium Benzoate, Glycerin, Decyl Glucoside, Citric Acid, Propylene Glycol, Sodium Citrate, and Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract.

Skin-friendly Wipes: As an alternative to traditional tree-based baby wipes, our wipes utilize bamboo viscose fiber. Bamboo grasses regenerate in as little as 3-4 months, whereas trees can take up to 30 years to regrow. This plant-based approach ensures a sustainable and gentle solution for your baby's hygiene needs.

99.7% RO Water for Baby's Sensitive Skin: Our liquid formula consists of 99.7% RO (Reverse Osmosis) water, offering enhanced safety and purity. It is suitable for direct application to your baby's skin, providing a reliable and gentle cleansing experience.

Fragrance-Free Wipes: Our wipes are free from any added fragrance, embodying a gentle and natural essence similar to lint and water. These qualities make our wipes suitable for use from birth onwards, effectively cleaning not only your baby's bottom but also their hands and face with utmost care.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars slightly expensive wipe made of eco friendly bamboo viscose fiber does the job
reviews.reviewText: Pros: biodegradable eco friendly bamboo viscose fiber;Cons: is at the expensive side;Notes: a subtle fresh scent, which I believe comes from the "Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract"I ordered a pack of 4 of these biodegradable diapers, and I really like them because they are made with bamboo viscose fiber, which is environmentally friendly. The pack comes in a bag containing 4 small packs, and each pack has 60 wipes. The package indicates that it contains 99.7% reverse osmosis (RO) processed water, which is supposed to be very clean. Although it claims to be fragrance-free, the wipes still have a subtle fresh scent, which I believe comes from the "Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract" mentioned in the ingredients.More about the "Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract" (I didn't go through the details about these papers but only checked some conclusions and part of the results section):According to some journal publications [1], this extract is believed to have antimicrobial and antiviral properties and is not toxic (as stated in publication [2]). Aloe barbadensis gel has been used for thousands of years to moisturize the skin. And in [2] it mentioned that "Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract" has "No reactions on either irradiated or nonirradiated test material contact sites were observed. No dermal phototoxicity observed" in Table 14 of the publication. And in the conclusion section it mentioned "are safe as cosmetic ingredients in the practices of use and concentrations as described in this safety assessment, if anthraquinone levels in the ingredients do not exceed 50 ppm".About the size of the wipes:Without unfolding, the wipe is approximately 15 * 8 cm (6 * 3.5 inches). When unfolded, each wipe measures about 19 * 8 cm (7.5 * 3.5 inches). The wipes are highly stretchable along the longer edge (I tested and could stretch one up to 30 cm, and it didn't rebound), but they do not stretch along the short edges.Overall, I believe these wipes get the job done while also being eco-friendly. However, they are slightly more expensive than regular wipes. I would rate them 4.7 out of 5 stars.References:[1] Sharrif Moghaddasi, M., and M. Res. "Aloe vera their chemicals composition and applications: A review." Int J Biol Med Res 2.1 (2011): 466-71.[2] Cosmetic Ingredient Review Expert Panel. "Final report on the safety assessment of aloeandongensis extract, aloe andongensis leaf juice, aloe arborescens leaf extract, aloe arborescens leaf juice, aloe arborescens leaf protoplasts, aloe barbadensis flower extract, aloe barbadensis leaf, aloe barbadensis leaf extract, aloe barbadensis leaf juice, aloe barbadensis leaf polysaccharides, aloe barbadensis leaf water, aloe ferox leaf extract, aloe ferox leaf juice, and aloe ferox leaf juice extract." International Journal of Toxicology 26 (2007): 1-50.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These eco friendly wipes are pretty soft but not as soft as I would like for a baby. I use them to clean my hands instead sometimes and they are fine for that. I like that they don't have a scent and are biodegradable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good product and responsive manufacturer
reviews.reviewText: UPDATED REVIEW: I have revised my review to 5 stars for two reasons, because the manufacturer addressed my concerns that I had listed in my initial review. In my initial review, I stated that I thought the product was good and packaged well, but I had concerns about disclosure about the ingredients and testing.The manufacturer reached out and clarified for me that the listed ingredients are in fact the full ingredients. I understood that the list of ingredients was the full ingredients, but that the ingredients on the labeling had been mislabeled as "main ingredients" only (implying that certain ingredients were not listed) due to a translation issue.In addition, the manufacturer provided me with the product testing and certification report prepared by their third-party testing vendor, via the Amazon seller messaging system. I did not have any concerns about the test report upon reviewing the report. You should feel free to ask for it yourself, as they sent the full document without any issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Second to the worst wipes I’ve ever tried. I was SO so hopeful about these because I love the EcoBoom diapers, but they let me down. For starters, they are very thin. Second, they don’t seem to grab poop or food well as they don’t have much texture to them. Lastly, the way the wipes are folded inside the package make it exceedingly difficult to pull the wipes out. I’m used to wipes being folded into each other, accordion style, so that when you pull one it gets the next one ready for you. That is NOT the case here. Each wipe is folded individually, causing you to have to dig for the each one. Suuuuper frustrating in the middle of a poopy diaper change. I am so glad we are working on the last pack, and I will not be buying these again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value Smell is Manageable
reviews.reviewText: Was hoping they were scentless, but it's more of a natural smell and tolerable, doesn't irritate. Wipes are thin but surprisingly effective. Great value, and all pop tops, no refill style packs. Will last a long time! Entirely worth it! perfect amount of moisture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Stingy on rubbed skin.
reviews.reviewText: As much as I wanted to love it, somehow my baby was crying every time I used it on her rubbed skin. I didn’t realize until I used it on my rubbed skin, yikes! It’s stingy and burns! Definitely not recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Thick, relatively gentle bamboo wipes
reviews.reviewText: These wipes aren't sanitizing, which I didn't realize when I initially purchased them, but if you are looking for a gentle, environmentally friendly wipe to keep your baby clean and fresh, these do the trick. They are a little tougher than cotton wipes, and each container of wipes is surprisingly heavy. They also can bunch together when you try to take them out of the package, which is annoying. However, they are sturdy, well moisturized, unscented and definitely do the trick.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These are the worst baby wipes I have ever tried!!! They DO NOT come out of the package, they stick together in clumps and you have to carefully unfold each individual wipe. Who has time to do that when you have a squirmy baby smearing poop everywhere? They are small in size, making them more difficult to use. Also they come wrapped in multiple layers of plastic, defeating the point to be environmentally friendly by spending more on bamboo. Don't waste your money on these, If you are super curious at least buy one individual package to test them out. I purchased the large quantity thinking it was a better deal, but now I am stuck with so many packages of wipes I dread having to use up!
